title: Filipino Beef Steak Recipe
description: This beef steak is a quick and easy Filipino dish with meat marinated in lemon juice and soy sauce, pan-fried, and served with fried onion and garlic.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Filipino Beef Steak 4.5 (53) 29 Reviews 25 Photos This beef steak is a very easy recipe to make. A tender cut of beef is sliced thin, then marinated with lemon juice and soy sauce for at least an hour. Submitted by lola Updated on November 13, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 25 25 25 25 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 4 pounds New York strip steak, sliced thin 1 lemon, juiced 3 tablespoons soy sauce 1 teaspoon white sugar salt and pepper to taste 1 tablespoon cornstarch ¼ cup vegetable oil 3 tablespoons olive oil 1 onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, chopped Directions Place sliced beef in a large bowl. Whisk together lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and pepper in a small bowl; pour over beef and toss to coat. Stir in cornstarch. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove beef slices from marinade, shaking to remove any excess liquid. Discard marinade. Working in batches, fry beef slices in hot oil until they start to firm and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, 2 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer beef slices to a serving platter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until onion is golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes; spoon over beef slices. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 151 home cooks made it!
